intro: Aspidium luerssenii, commonly known as the Lürsenii water fern, is a species of aquatic fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, floating fronds that are typically divided into small, serrated segments. The plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and streams, where it can anchor itself to submerged surfaces. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, typical of the fern family. Aspidium luerssenii plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen through photosynthesis.
